com.redhat.rhn.common.localization
Class LocalizationService

java.lang.Object
  com.redhat.rhn.common.localization.LocalizationService

public class LocalizationService
extends java.lang.Object

Localization service class to simplify the job for producing localized (translated) strings within the product.

Field Detail

RHN_DB_DATEFORMAT

public static final java.lang.String RHN_DB_DATEFORMAT
DateFormat used by RHN database queries. Useful for converting RHN dates into java.util.Dates so they can be formatted based on Locale.

See Also:

public java.lang.String getDebugMessage(java.lang.String messageId)

formatDate

public java.lang.String formatDate(java.util.Date date,
                                   java.util.Locale locale)
Format the date based on the locale and convert it to a String to display. Uses DateFormat.SHORT. Example: 2004-12-10 13:20:00 PST Also includes the timezone of the current User if there is one

Parameters:
date - Date to format.
locale - Locale to use for formatting.
Returns:
String representation of given date in given locale.

formatCustomDate

public java.lang.String formatCustomDate(java.util.Date date)
Returns fixed custom format string displayed for the determined timezone Example: 2010-04-01 15:04:24 CEST

Parameters:
date - Date to format.
Returns:
String representation of given date for set timezone

formatNumber

public java.lang.String formatNumber(java.lang.Number numberIn,
                                     int fractionalDigits)
Format the Number based on the locale and convert it to a String to display. Use a specified number of fraction digits.

Parameters:
numberIn - Number to format.
fractionalDigits - The number of fractional digits to use. This is both the minimum and maximum that will be displayed.
Returns:
String representation of given number in given locale.

numberIn - Number to format.
localeIn - Locale to use for formatting.
fractionalDigits - The maximum number of fractional digits to use.

availablePrefixes

public java.util.SortedSet availablePrefixes()

Returns:
SortedSet sorted set of available prefixes.

availableCountries

public java.util.SortedMap availableCountries()
Get a SortedMap containing NAME/CODE value pairs. The reason we key the Map based on the NAME is that we desire to maintain a localized sort order based on the display value and not the code. 
     {name=Spain,     code=ES}
     {name=Sri Lanka, code=LK}
     {name=Sudan,     code=SD}
     {name=Suriname,  code=SR, }
     etc ...

Returns:
SortedMap sorted map of available countries.

messageId - we are searching for
Returns:
boolean if we have loaded this message

newCollator

public java.text.Collator newCollator()
Returns a NEW instance of the collator/string comparator based on the current locale.. Look at the javadoc for COllator to see what it does... (basically an i18n aware string comparator)

Returns:
neww instance of the collator
